cleaned_text: Standard Benefits include: No co-payments Language translation services Checkups for the doctor when you are eye health Rides Care Needs Please Managed Care HelpLine if you or family members have special needs or get care for: special All MCOs other than English. A monthly premium is paid by the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services to your MCO for your coverage. If you are found to be ineligible for prior months of coverage due to your failure to report truthful information or changes in your circumstances to your worker, you may have to repay these monthly premiums, even if you received no medical services during those months.You may not be eligible to enroll in an MCO if you have other primary insurance, are in a nursing home, or are participating in a home and community-based care waiver. If you have one of these or other circumstances that you feel make you ineligible to enroll in an MCO, please contact the Managed Care HelpLine.Equal Opportunity Statement Department of Medical Assistance Services are available without regard to race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, age, disabilities, national origin, ancestry or language barriers. The information in this chart is correct to the best of our knowledge. Information may change without notice. For updated information, call 1-800-643-2273 or visit our website at at the letterMCO Comparison Chart An MCO is a Managed Care Organization (health plan) For these cities and counties: Alexandria, Arlington, Clarke, Culpeper, Falls Church, Fairfax City, Fairfax County, Fauquier, Frederick, City, Manassas Park, Page, Prince William, Shenandoah, Winchester For more information visit www.virginiamanagedcare.com1 3Call to enrollIf you want to keep the MCO that we selected for you, you do not have to do anything else. 2Read the chart Abra este panfleto y encontrará esta información en español, en la partede adentro.If you want to choose a different MCO, read the chart on the next page. Call us only if you want to choose a different MCO. Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services NVA/WIN Revised 1113Look at the letter that came with this chart. You will see that we have selected an MCO for you. You can keep that MCO, or you can read the chart on the next page to learn more about other MCOs in your area. If you choose the MCO in the letter, you do not have to call or go to Steps 2 and 3. You do not have to do anything else. If you do not want the MCO in the letter, go to Steps 2 and 3. Read the chart on the next page. Compare the MCOs in your city or county and choose the best one for you and your family. Call the Managed Care HelpLine at 1-800-643-2273 (TDD 1-800-817-6608). You can call Monday to Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. The call is free and we have interpreter and translator services. We are here to help you. We can: Help you enroll in a health plan Tell you your PCP is in benefits with any problemsAnthem serves these cities and counties: Alexandria, Arlington, Clarke, Culpeper, Church, Fairfax City, Fairfax County, Fauquier, Frederick, City, Manassas Park, Page, Prince William, Rappahannock, Shenandoah, Warren, Winchester For a list of doctors in Anthem call 1-800-901-0020 For more information about Anthem 1-757-326-5090 members can Hospital Loudoun Hospital INOVA Mount Vernon Hospital Mary Washington Page Hospital Prince William Hospital Reston Hospital Center Sentara Hospitals (Martha Jefferson, Northern Virginia Medical Rockingham Memorial) Shenandoah Memorial Hospital Snowden at Fredericksburg Spotsylvania Regional Medical Center Stafford Hospital Center University of Virginia Medical Center Virginia Hospital Center Warren Memorial MinuteClinic pregnant wear INTotal Health serves these cities and counties: Alexandria, Arlington, Clarke, Culpeper, Fairfax City, Fairfax County, Falls Church, Fauquier, Frederick, City, Manassas Park, Page, Prince William, Rappahannock, Shenandoah, Warren, Winchester For a list of doctors in INTotal Health call 1-855-323-5588 For more information about INTotal Health call 1-855-323-5588 www.intotalhealth.orgINTotal Health members can use these Children's Culpeper Regional Dominion Alexandria Fairfax Hospital Fairfax Hospital for Children INOVA Fair Hospital INOVA Mount Vernon Hospital INOVA Loudoun Hospital Martha Jefferson Hospital Page Memorial Prince Potomac Hospital Reston Hospital Center Shenandoah Memorial University of Virginia Medical Center Virginia Hospital Center Warren Memorial Winchester Medical Center For a complete list of facilities available to INTotal Health throughout Virginia, please visit our at www.intotalhealth.org. Or call 1-855-323-5588. For emergency care, members may go to any hospital.INTotal Health extra programs and services: No-cost Boys & Girls Club membership No-cost sports physicals for members ages 10 to 18 Asthma & Diabetes management program Starring: Baby and Me® program for all pregnant members 100 free minutes review benefits and coordinate care Kaiser Permanente serves these cities and counties: Alexandria, Arlington, Fairfax City, Fairfax County, Falls Church, Loudoun, Manassas City, Manassas Park, Prince William For a list of doctors in Kaiser Permanente call 1-855-249-5025 For more information about Kaiser Permanente call 1-855-249-5025 www.kp.org/medicaid/vaKaiser Permanente members can use the following medical centers: Ashburn Medical Center, VA Burke Medical Center, VA Fair Oaks Medical Center, VA Falls Church Medical Center, VA Manassas Medical Center, VA * Reston Medical Center, VA Springfield Medical Center, VA * Tysons Corner Medical Center, VA * Woodbridge Medical Center, VA * After hours/weekend urgent care Kaiser Permanente members can use the following hospitals: Children's National Medical Center, DC MedStar Georgetown Medical Center, DC Mary Washington Hospital, VA Reston Hospital Center, VA Stafford Hospital, VA Virginia Hospital Center, VA Washington Hospital Center, DC The list of hospitals may not represent a complete list of facilities available to Kaiser Permanente members. Call one of our Member Service representatives at 1-855-249-5025 if you have any extra programs and services: Medical advice line available 24 hours doctor, make appointments, refill prescriptions, check lab results all online or on phone (when using Permanente physicians) Pharmacy, lab, and x-rays/imaging in same building as your doctor (when using Kaiser Permanente medical centers) Mail order and retail pharmacy options Telephonic interpreter services at any appointment at Kaiser Permanente (over 180 languages) Online tools and calculators for health risks Online pressure, nutrition, weight management, smoking cessation, and heart failure at Kaiser Permanente medical centers Prenatal and breastfeeding classes Disease management programs: Member discount programs for fitness club membership, chiropractic care, walking programs, vitamin and herbal supplements Family Care serves these cities and counties: Page For a list of doctors in Optima Family Care call 1-800-881-2166 For more information about Family Care call 1-800-881-2166 or 1-757-552-8975 www.optimahealth.comFamily Care members can use Martha Hospital Mary Memorial Hospital Rockingham Memorial Shenandoah Memorial Hospital University of Virginia Medical Center Warren Memorial Hospital Winchester Medical Center The list of hospitals does not represent a complete list of facilities available to Family Care members. Call one of our Member Service representatives at 1-800-881-2166 if you have any questions.Family Care extra programs and serves these cities and counties: Clarke, Frederick, Page, Shenandoah, Winchester For a list of doctors in VAPremier call 1-800-727-7536 For more information about members use Mary Washington Page Memorial Hospital Rockingham Memorial Shenandoah Memorial Hospital University of Virginia Medical Center VCU Health System (MCV) Warren Hospital programs Case Management nurses help adults NVA/WIN Revised 1113Cuadro de comparación de MCO Una MCO es una organización de atención administrada (plan de salud) Para estas ciudades y condados: Alexandria, Arlington, Clarke, Culpeper, Falls Church, Fairfax City, Fairfax County, Fauquier, Frederick, City, Manassas Park, Page, Prince William, Rappahannock, Shenandoah, Warren, Winchester Si quiere más información, visite www.virginiamanagedcare.com Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services NVA/WIN Revisado 11131 3Llame para inscribirse2Lea el cuadro Si quiere elegir una MCO diferente, lea el cuadro de la siguiente página. Llame solamente si quiere elegir una MCO diferente. Lea la carta Si quiere conservar la MCO que elegimos para usted, no tiene que hacer nada más.Lea la carta que viene con este cuadro. Usted verá que hemos seleccionado una MCO para usted. Usted puede conservar esta MCO o puede leer el cuadro de la siguiente página para ver otras MCO en su área. Si elige la MCO de la carta, no tiene que llamar ni leer los pasos 2 y 3. No tiene que hacer nada más. Si usted no quiere la MCO de la carta, lea los pasos 2 y 3. Lea el cuadro de la siguiente página. Compare las MCO en su ciudad o condado y elija la mejor para usted y su familia. Llame a la línea de ayuda de atención administrada al 1-800-643-2273 (TDD 1-800-817-6608). Usted puede llamar de lunes a viernes de 8:30 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. La llamada es gratuita y tenemos servicios de intérpretes y traductores. Estamos aquí para ayudarlo. Podemos: Ayudarlo a unirse a un plan de salud Decirle a qué planes pertenece su doctor Contestar preguntas sobre sus beneficios Ayudarlo con cualquier problema Los beneficios estándard incluyen: No tiene co-pagos Servicios de traducción Chequeos para los niños Visitas al doctor cuando usted está enfermo Servicios de hospital Cuidado de emergencia Servicios de laboratorio Prescripciones médicas (remedios) Servicios de planificación familiar Radiografías y tomografías Servicios de salud mental Exámen de ojos de rutina y anteojos (gafas) para niños Exámen de ojos para adultos Servicios de cuidado de salud a domicilio Transporte a las visitas médicas Maternidad y cuidado prenatal de alto riesgo Cuidado del recién nacido Inmunizaciones (vacunas) para niños Terapia física, ocupacional y del habla Línea de ayuda fuera de horaCuidado de salud para niños Todas las MCOs proveen: Inmunizaciones (vacunas) Chequeos hasta los 21 años Exámenes de la vista Educación para la salud Servicios para personas con necesidades médicas especiales Chequeos por envenenamiento por plomo Chequeos con el audiólogo (oído)Necesidades médicas especiales Por favor llame a la línea de ayuda de atención administrada, si una persona de su familia tiene alguna necesidad médica especial, como por ejemplo: Embarazo Problemas de corazón Presión arterial alta Asma u problemas respiratorios Problemas o diálisis VIH/SIDA Salud mental Diabetes Cáncer Servicios de cuidado de salud a domicilio Equipo médico especial Otras necesidades médicas especiales Todas las MCOs pueden darle listas de PCPs (doctores) que hablan otros idiomas que no sean inglés. Puede ser que usted no se pueda subscribir (unir) a una MCO si tiene otro seguro médico primario, en una casa de cuidados o si usted participa en la exclusión (waiver) del cuidado de salud administrada por tener un hogar y recibir cuidado de un centro comunitario. Si usted tiene una de esas u otras condiciones, por las que cree que no puede tener derecho a unirse a una MCO, por favor contacte a la línea de ayuda de cuidado administrado.Declaración de Igualdad de Oportunidades Los servicios del departamento de asistencia médica se brindan sin tener en cuenta raza, color, credo, sexo, orientación sexual, edad, incapacidades, origen o barreras de idioma. La información de este cuadro es correcta a nuestro entender. La información puede cambiar sin previo aviso. Para información al día, llame al 1-800-643-2273 o visite nuestro sitio web en www.virginiamanagedcare.com.Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services paga una cuota mensual (prima) por su cobertura médica a su MCO. Si usted no reunió los requisitos por los meses anteriores de su cobertura, debido a que usted no envió la información correcta o cambios en su situación a su empleador (patrón), usted puede tener que reembolsar (pagar) las cuotas mensuales, si usted recibió servicios médicos durante esos meses. ¿Preguntas? Llame a la línea de ayuda de atención administrada al 1-800-643-2273 (TDD 1-800-817-6608) o visite nuestro sitio web en www.virginiamanagedcare.com NVA/WIN Revis ado 1113 El plan Anthem está en las
